etymology.description: 復(復) (fù, "return; repeat") and 興(興) (xīng, "rise; prosper") together convey the meaning of reviving or rejuvenating something back to its prosperous state.
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 復(復) (fù, "return; repeat") and 興(興) (xīng, "rise; prosper") reflects the idea of bringing something back to a state of prosperity or importance, echoing historical efforts to restore cultural or national greatness.

examples.chinese: 实现国家复兴需要改革(實現國家復興需要改革)，团结民心共创未来(團結民心共創未來)。
examples.pinyin: Shíxiàn guójiā fùxīng xūyào gǎigé, tuánjié mínxīn gòngchuàng wèilái.
examples.english: Reviving the nation requires reform, uniting the people to create a bright future.

examples.chinese: 文化复兴激发创新(文化復興激發創新)，吸引世界关注(吸引世界關注)。
examples.pinyin: Wénhuà fùxīng jīfā chuàngxīn, xīyǐn shìjiè guānzhù.
examples.english: Cultural revival stimulates innovation and attracts global attention.
